addNotificationExtender(extender) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.NotificationConfig
Add your own notification extender to customise the look of received notifications To customise the appearance or content of a notification, implement as many NotificationCompat.Extenders as you like Having access to the NotificationCompat.Builder means you can change pretty much whatever you like about the style and content of the notification. Check out the Android Developer docs here for more info. Note that if any extenders are added, they will by default override Sailthru’s notification extender. If you’d like us to still do our default notification extension, you can manually re-extend using class NotificationExtender For example, if you want to change the title of push notifications with the custom field special_price, you could implement the following NotificationCompat.Extender:

getImages() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.PurchaseItem
Set a map of image types full and/or thumb to objects specifying the URL for each image. Use the name “full” to denote the full-sized image, and “thumb” to denote the thumbnail-sized image. For example, the value of images might be: { “full” : { “url” : “http://example.com/f.jpg” }, “thumb” : { “url” : “http://example.com/t.jpg” } } This allows you to easily include product images when messaging users with order confirmations and abandoned-cart reminders.

getMessageId() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.Purchase
Set the message ID associated with the purchase. This is required to have revenue data matched to email sends in Sailthru. Pass the identifying message_id of the email the user is coming from; this will be the value stored in the sailthru_bid cookie for your domain.Note: In some client libraries message_id should be passed as a string. The message attribution will be displayed in your Campaign Summary, Transactional Report, Purchase Log, and in Lifecycle Optimizer Metrics.

getUrl() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.ContentItem
 
getUrl() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.PurchaseItem
The URL of the item. Note: The domain and scheme are case sensitive but paths are not. For example, if the stored URL is https://sailthru.com/Product, then Https://Sailthru.com/product would fail to match the product, but https://sailthru.com/product would.
getVars() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.ContentItem
 
getVars() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.Purchase
Any number of custom variables to attach to the order. These are commonly used with the Audience Builder “Purchase Order Var Is” query. For example, you could specify the shipping address, estimated delivery date given, credit card type used, whether a deal was used, the promo code used, etc.Note that a vars object may also exist at the item level. See the example code, and the items definition in this table.You may use any custom order variable name(s). Note that the following variable name is reserved at the order level, for a particular purpose: st_cost – The client’s cost for the items in the purchase, in cents. The value should be an integer, and is recommended if you are using Retention Analytics in order to report net revenue.
getVars() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.PurchaseItem
Vars can be any number of custom fields and values to attach to each item for later retrieval in templates or use in Audience Builder or Lifecycle Optimizer. For example, you may want to specify item attributes such as color, size, material, or an item-specific coupon code that was used.
getVideoUrlFromPayload() - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.NotificationBundle

H

handleNotification(remoteMessage) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Pass received notification to Sailthru Mobile SDK. NOTE: This method should only be called if the app implements its own FirebaseMessagingService instance, in which case it must be called in order to provide FCM notifications to the Sailthru Mobile SDK for processing. Otherwise this will be handled automatically by the Sailthru Mobile SDK.
handleSailthruLink(uri, handler) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
If you're using Sailthru email with universal links, your application will open with an encoded Sailthru link url. This method will decode the link URL and return its canonical location (ie https://link.sailthru.com/blahblah will redirect to https://www.sailthru.com/careers/list/, the link's canonical location), as well as making sure that the clickthrough metrics for this link are correctly attributed in the Sailthru platform. This method should be called from your receiving activity's onStart() method, and handle the starting intent's link data

setDefaultNotificationChannel(notificationChannel) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.NotificationConfig
Sets the notification channel on Oreo devices or later. Inaccessible pre-Oreo The NotificationChannel should be used for notification settings (vibration, sound, LED, etc) on devices >= Oreo instead of the options in this class, as it allows users more granular control of notification settings.
setDefaults(defaults) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.NotificationConfig
Set the default notification options that will be used. The value should be one or more of the following fields combined with a bitwise-or: Notification.DEFAULT_SOUND, Notification.DEFAULT_VIBRATE, Notification.DEFAULT_LIGHTS. For all default values, use Notification.DEFAULT_ALL.
setDeviceToken(token) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Pass the FCM token into the Sailthru Mobile SDK. NOTE: This method should only be called if the app implements its own FirebaseMessagingService instance, in which case it must be called in order to provide the FCM token to the Sailthru Mobile Platform. Otherwise this will be handled automatically by the Sailthru Mobile SDK.

setGeoIpTrackingEnabled(enabledGeoIp, handler) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Enabled location tracking based on IP Address. Tracking location tracking is enabled by default. Use this method for users who may not want to have their location tracked at all.
setGeoIpTrackingEnabled(enabledGeoIp) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Enabled location tracking based on IP Address. Tracking location tracking is enabled by default. Use this method for users who may not want to have their location tracked at all.
setImages(p) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.PurchaseItem
Set a map of image types full and/or thumb to objects specifying the URL for each image. Use the name “full” to denote the full-sized image, and “thumb” to denote the thumbnail-sized image. For example, the value of images might be: { “full” : { “url” : “http://example.com/f.jpg” }, “thumb” : { “url” : “http://example.com/t.jpg” } } This allows you to easily include product images when messaging users with order confirmations and abandoned-cart reminders.
setInAppNotificationsEnabled(enabled) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Enables or disables the display of In-App Notifications. Must be called before startEngine. In-App Notifications are enabled by default.

setLights(argb, onMs, offMs) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.NotificationConfig
Set the argb value that you would like the LED on the device to blink, as well as the rate. The rate is specified in terms of the number of milliseconds to be on and then the number of milliseconds to be off.

setMessageId(p) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.Purchase
Set the message ID associated with the purchase. This is required to have revenue data matched to email sends in Sailthru. Pass the identifying message_id of the email the user is coming from; this will be the value stored in the sailthru_bid cookie for your domain.Note: In some client libraries message_id should be passed as a string. The message attribution will be displayed in your Campaign Summary, Transactional Report, Purchase Log, and in Lifecycle Optimizer Metrics.

setVars(p) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.Purchase
Any number of custom variables to attach to the order. These are commonly used with the Audience Builder “Purchase Order Var Is” query. For example, you could specify the shipping address, estimated delivery date given, credit card type used, whether a deal was used, the promo code used, etc.Note that a vars object may also exist at the item level. See the example code, and the items definition in this table.You may use any custom order variable name(s). Note that the following variable name is reserved at the order level, for a particular purpose: st_cost – The client’s cost for the items in the purchase, in cents. The value should be an integer, and is recommended if you are using Retention Analytics in order to report net revenue.
setVars(p) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.model.PurchaseItem
Vars can be any number of custom fields and values to attach to each item for later retrieval in templates or use in Audience Builder or Lifecycle Optimizer. For example, you may want to specify item attributes such as color, size, material, or an item-specific coupon code that was used.
setVibrate(pattern) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.NotificationConfig
Set the vibration pattern to use. On some platforms, a notification that vibrates is more likely to be presented as a heads-up notification.

trackImpression(sectionId, urls, handler) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Asynchronously registers an impression - a reasonable expectation that a user has seen a piece of content - with Sailthru SPM. Can be used in conjunction with RecyclerView.Adapter#onViewAttachedToWindow or similar to know when a particular content item has entered the user's viewport.
trackPageview(url, tags, handler) - Method in class com.sailthru.mobile.sdk.SailthruMobile
Asynchronously registers that the given "page" has been viewed with Sailthru SPM. Note that a Content View here directly corresponds to a page view in SPM.
